greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = floor(n / 3) * 3 + sign(n mod 3) * (3 - n mod 3).
comment: Take natural numbers, exchange trisections starting with 1 and 2.
The sequence is A008585 interleaved with A016789 and A016777.

a(n) is also obtained as follows: write n in base 3; if the rightmost digit is '1', then replace it with '2' and vice versa; convert back to decimal. For example a(14) = a('11'2') = '11'1' = 13 and a(10) = a('10'1') = '10'2' = 11.
A permutation of the nonnegative integers partitioned into triples [3*k-3, 3*k-1, 3*k-2] for k > 0. - _Guenther Schrack_, Feb 05 2020
link: Muniru A Asiru, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..3000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Alternating Permutations
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,1,-1).
formula: a(n) = A001477(n) + A102283(n). - _Jaume Oliver Lafont_, Dec 05 2008
a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-3) - a(n-4) for n > 3. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Oct 06 2017
mathematica: Table[2 n - 3 - 3 Floor[(n - 2)/3], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Nov 30 2013 *)
program: (GAP) a:=[0,2,1,3];; for n in [5..100] do a[n]:=a[n-1]+a[n-3]-a[n-4]; od; a; # _Muniru A Asiru_, Jul 27 2018
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 15 2001
